Articles.Content:
No, no, no, and no.

Stores of knowledge no-one may see

Abutting spacetimes; energy

Is needed yet to make them real

As the strings the present must feel.

That present may elude our grasp

When what's to come we spy in glass.

Week foll'wing week, day after day,

A year or more to maybe stay.

I've not tried to make this easy

But I do hope it is not cheesy.

Hint 1: You can find one in the solar system.

A gravity well?

Stupid people?

A cheese factory?

A cheese product.

Moon cheese!!!

gift wrapped cheese gifts?

A gift thing with salami/meats and cheeses?! (These are products that can last a year or more if stored correctly.)

Maybe it's not astronomical but related to selling cheese? String is used to cut cheese. You see it through glass in a store. The store is in, at least, this solar system. Maybe the astronomical sounding stuff eludes to a company or product name or something. Maybe the astrological hints are to throw us off!!!

Fondue!!!!??

If present means present like gift. What would elude your grasp if put in, under, or behind glass? I'm thinking food now. Maybe for aging or storage. Or like in a store or watching something being made that isn't ready or something similar.

Is he eating fondue while writing his riddles?

Cheese covered popcorn? Maybe in an old fashion popcorn maker!! 8D Also other forms of popcorn. Popcorn!!

^He's thinking boy these guys are dumb and then thought about eating popcorn and mocking us like in a thread reference. So he used it as the riddle!!

Cheese filled sausage?

Pizza?

Edited March 13, 2015 by Arugela

a planet then?

Changed guess to the Sun, as the hint says 'you can find ONE in the solar system'.

Edited March 13, 2015 by CelticCossack51
politness FTW!

Anybody else feels like Arugela is losing his sanity? (probably unrelated -> <- this emoticon is called "Cheesy" in the advanced reply page (also unrelated, but I want some cheese now))

Could the answer be an Alcubierre drive? (or any FTL drive)

EDIT: That wouldn't work because they're just speculative ideas. How can we find it in the solar system if it's not real?

Edited March 13, 2015 by Deutherius

Yea, I need something to eat!! 8p

At first I look up. then Down. then I hear a mighty sound. What am I? (don't answer this!)

I ate a bagel I feel better.

Is it a vegetable or a mineral!!??

A giant pile of crap!!! >< <- there be many mysteries to be found in there! Watch Jurassic park!

This doesn't have anything to do with the ...... monologues does it? Or a surrounding philosophy?

Edited March 13, 2015 by Arugela

I've not tried to make this easy

But I do hope it is not cheesy.

Hint 1: You can find one in the solar system.

Interstellar? (the film)

or indeed, any other sci-fi film?

EDIT: or just film/TV in general?

None so far. And an interesting analysis from Arugela, but the riddle does say "not cheesy"

Also a bit spamming guesses from Arugela. There's no formal rule but I personally don't like to put more than three guesses per post, and usually just put one.
The Large Hadron Collider. Or a particle accelerator in general.
Electrons neutrons gamma radiation beta radiation the other type of radiation (couldn't remember for the life of me)

The unknown?

EDIT: I swear, next riddle I get to post will destroy you.

Edited March 13, 2015 by Xannari Ferrows

Higgs Boson?

An ion engine?

Cantab's brain?

EDIT: Another hint?

Edited March 13, 2015 by TheMoonRover

Not any form of radiation nor any of the other new guesses. And newhint? Eh, I suppose so...seems a bit soon after the last though.

Hint 1: You can find one in the solar system.

Hint 2: You can find one on Earth.
